list.title: deployDocs
list.description: Deploys the documentation by committing and pushing changes to the "docs" subtree.

list.title: getCurrentDeveloperName
list.description: Gets the name or username of the developer from Git's global configuration.

list.title: getDocsPath
list.description: Gets the absolute path of the "docs" directory using Git's root path.

list.title: module:App
list.description:
Imports necessary modules for the Express application.

express The Express.js web application framework. http The Node.js built-in HTTP module. body-parser Middleware for parsing incoming request bodies. cookie-parser Middleware for parsing cookies. compression Middleware for compressing response bodies. cors Middleware for enabling Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS).

list.title: module:App~app
list.description: Creates an instance of the Express application.

list.title: module:App~server
list.description: Creates an instance of the http server

list.title: module:CompanyModel~updateCompanyById
list.description: Updates the company with the ID of the company

list.title: module:Config
list.description: General configurations and common constants for APIs

list.title: module:Config~GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID
list.description: Client ID for Google OAuth. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET
list.description: Client secret for Google OAuth. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~MAIL_HOST
list.description: Mail host for sending emails. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~MAIL_PASSWORD
list.description: Mail password for sending emails. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~MAIL_PORT
list.description: Mail port for sending emails. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~MAIL_USER
list.description: Mail user for sending emails. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~MONGO_PASSWORD
list.description: Mongo password. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~MONGO_URL
list.description: Connection string for MongoDB. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~MONGO_USER
list.description: Mongo user. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~PAYSTACK_LIVE_KEY
list.description: Live Key for Paystack. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~PAYSTACK_TEST_KEY
list.description: Test key for Paystack. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~PORT
list.description: Port number for the server. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~SPACES_BUCKET
list.description: Bucket name for Spaces. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~SPACES_KEY
list.description: Key for Spaces. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~SPACES_SECRET
list.description: Secret for Spaces. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~UUID_KEY
list.description: Key for UUID. This is extracted from the environment variable

list.title: module:Config~explorer
list.description: Loads the environment file (Looks for it within the project scope) the environment file is not .env but .envrc.json. An example file (".envrc.example.json" which is a copy of it) has been added for reference. Just like the .env file, the .envrc.json file is a JSON file. The .env files are in key-value pair. For every environment variable you want to use, it is recommended you add it to the .envrc.json file and export it as a constant in the config.js (this file)

list.title: module:Database~connectToDatabase
list.description: Async function that connects to the database

list.description: (Middleware) Ensures that the user is authenticated by Google.

list.description: (Middleware) Ensures that the user is authenticated.
